intro: Syngonanthus flavipes, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family, characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish flowers. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. Syngonanthus flavipes plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
